p.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 12pt; font-family: Calibri, sans-serif;

div.p:
Starting Thursday, April 9 we will begin handing out homework packets for the students during the grab & go lunch from 12 to 1:00 PM. There will be some staff members available to help hand out the packets, notes & instructions for teaching and learning. We are asking for your cooperation and patience as we will work to hand out the packets to everyone while doing our best to comply with PED requirements for remote teaching and learning. We need your help in keeping in touch with the students' teachers.
Each student at the high school will be required to maintain proper communication and cooperation with the assignments and instructions from his or her teacher in order to receive a pass for the class and in order to receive credit. Failure to comply may result in a no pass, no credit for the course.
Students at the elementary level will need to pick up weekly packets every Thursday and communicate with the teacher on a weekly basis. Further instructions will be made available by the teachers. We are planning for 6 weeks of instruction. If you are unable to pick up packets please notify any staff member and we will work to ensure you receive the materials. Together we can do this! Please continue to check the school website for updates and important announcements. Thank you and please stay well.

div.style: color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;
color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;
color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;
font-size: 13px; font-family: Tahoma;
color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-size: 16px; font-family: Arial;
font-size: 13px; font-family: Tahoma;

br.br:
Please read a message from Christina Vigil for all students and parents. You will find this letter on the right side of this website page under Newsletter.
Click on Newsletter to read.
Special Board Meeting Tuesday, March 31, 2020, at 5:00 p.m. in the Admin Building.

Please be advised that this meeting will be broadcast live on Facebook on the Springer Muncipal Schools page. There is more than one Springer Municipal Schools page; be aware of that. The meeting is closed to the public, per the governor's order. However, you may watch us on Facebook.
Lunch will be served by A'viands food service at SHS for both elementary and high school students. The menu is posted on this website on the right hand side under "Lunch Menu." Lunch will be served from 12:00 p.m. to 1:00 p.m. This is free for all Springer Municipal School students. They will begin serving Monday, March 23, 2020.
Please be advised: Springer Municipal Schools will be closed through the end of the current school year, per the governor of NM and NMPED. In a press conference on Monday, March 23, 2020, Governor Grisham issued a stay-at-home order that lasts until April 10, 2020. All school personnel, except for administration and custodial staff, are restricted from accessing any building during this time period.
The technology meeting set for Tuesday, March 24, 2020, has been postponed. We will reschedule at a later date. The parent/teacher conference has been canceled.
The Pee Wee Tournament has been canceled.
Sales for the the Class of 2020 Krispy Kreme Doughnuts have been canceled.
The senior trip has been canceled.
The Student Empowerment Symposium and Blood Drive have been canceled.
The prom has been canceled.
Per NMPED, missed days will not have to be made up. All staff and teachers will continue to be paid.

span.span: Thank you, Springer and the surrounding area. We appreciate you so much and your support for the class of 2020.

span.br:
Class Colors: Turquoise and Black
Class Motto: "Chase your dreams but always know the road that will lead you home again."
Class Flower: Tiger Rose
Class Song: Five More Minutes
Graduation Date: Saturday, May 16, 2020, at 2:00 p.m. at Sim Brown Gym: Likely Canceled
Class of 2020 Graduates
Joshua Archuleta
Alex Arellano
Owen Burton
Chase Casias
Antonio Chavez
Gabriel Garcia
Martina Martinez
Jake Peek
Jose Urquijo
Our bond issue passed by a wide majority. Springer Municipal Schools would like to thank our community for voting in favor of this bond. Thank you for caring for our students and children.
